thread.title: Inventor and InventHelp Client Develops Fashionable Bicycle (AVZ-1256)
thread.title_full: Inventor and InventHelp Client Develops Fashionable Bicycle (AVZ-1256)

author: Chrissa Chverchko
title: Inventor and InventHelp Client Develops Fashionable Bicycle (AVZ-1256)
text:
"I have always loved riding bikes, and I wanted to design one that was truly different from all the others," said an inventor from Riverton, Wyo. "I put my mind to it and came up with this redesigned bicycle that incorporates the best of all aspects of cycling." He developed the patent-pending MONKEY BIKE to feature an attractive and stylish design. It serves as a conversation piece and is designed to attract the attention of onlookers. The bike is easy and fun to ride and promotes outdoor exercise. Also, it serves as an alternative to conventional bicycles.
The original design was submitted to the Telemarketing office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-AVZ-1256, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
